title: How to Make Twig Star Decorations

steps.headline: With a ruler, mark 4 ⁄2 inch (11.4 cm) sections on the twigs with your pencil.
Cut twigs at the marks with pruning shear.
Warning:  If using a knife, place twig on a flat and damage resistant surface before cutting.
Cross two of the twig pieces at a point ½ inch down from their tops.
steps.description: Angle the pieces so they look like the top of a pyramid.

steps.headline: Wrap a 5 inch (12.7 cm) piece of wire around the intersection point to the twigs, circling BOTH horizontally and vertically at least once.
steps.description: Do not worry if the twigs are still a little loose. This looseness will be reinforced later.

steps.headline: Place the 3rd twig horizontally across the first two, about 1 inch (2.5 cm) down from the intersection of the first two twigs.
Wrap 5 inch (12.7 cm) pieces of wire around the newly made intersections, circling in BOTH diagonal directions at least once.
Place the 4th twig diagonally on the rest of the twigs, starting about ½ inch from the left side of the horizontal twig and ending about ½ inch up from the bottom right twig.
steps.description: Wrap a 5 inch (12.7 cm) section of wire around the new intersections in the same manner as described in steps 4 and 6.

steps.headline: Place the 5th twig diagonally on the rest of the twigs, starting about ½ inch from the right side of the horizontal twig and ending about ½ inch up from the bottom left twig.
steps.description: Wrap 5 inch (12.7 cm) pieces of wire around the new intersections.

steps.headline: Wrap wire around any loose intersections, if needed.
Finally, loop a piece of ribbon through the top intersection of the star.
steps.description: Make a tie at the top of the ribbon.

text: With a ruler, mark 4 ⁄2 inch (11.4 cm) sections on the twigs with your pencil. Make five 4 ⁄2 inch (11.4 cm) sections. Cut twigs at the marks with pruning shear.  Warning:  If using a knife, place twig on a flat and damage resistant surface before cutting.  Cross two of the twig pieces at a point ½ inch down from their tops. Angle the pieces so they look like the top of a pyramid. Wrap a 5 inch (12.7 cm) piece of wire around the intersection point to the twigs, circling BOTH horizontally and vertically at least once. Do not worry if the twigs are still a little loose. This looseness will be reinforced later. Place the 3rd twig horizontally across the first two, about 1 inch (2.5 cm) down from the intersection of the first two twigs.  Wrap 5 inch (12.7 cm) pieces of wire around the newly made intersections, circling in BOTH diagonal directions at least once.  Place the 4th twig diagonally on the rest of the twigs, starting about ½ inch from the left side of the horizontal twig and ending about ½ inch up from the bottom right twig. Wrap a 5 inch (12.7 cm) section of wire around the new intersections in the same manner as described in steps 4 and 6. Place the 5th twig diagonally on the rest of the twigs, starting about ½ inch from the right side of the horizontal twig and ending about ½ inch up from the bottom left twig. Wrap 5 inch (12.7 cm) pieces of wire around the new intersections. Wrap wire around any loose intersections, if needed.  Finally, loop a piece of ribbon through the top intersection of the star. Make a tie at the top of the ribbon.
